title_sort: walt whitman to talcott williams, 14 december 1884
title: Walt Whitman to Talcott Williams, 14 December 1884
text: A-1127328 Mickle StreetCamdenDec. 14 '84My dear friendUpon the whole I shall have to beg off from Monday night. The doctor enjoins upon me that I am like an old wagon body—must keep rigidly to the smooth ordinarily traveled roads, & not cut across lots any how. Give my friendliest greetings & wishes to Miss Terry & Mr Irving—Should they, or either, feel any day—say from 2 to 3 in the afternoon—like calling upon me here, I should rate it a welcome honor.—If you have not procured the tickets before receiving this let them go unprocured—Best remembrances to Mrs. Williams.Walt WhitmanShow this note to Miss Terry and Mr Irving—& if Miss T has the least desire to keep it, please let her do so. Walt Whitman to Talcott Williams, 14 December 1884
